oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tertiary butylation of phenol over mesoporous H-FeMCM-41
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BADAMALI, SK
SAKTHIVEL, A
SELVAM, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: molecular-sieves
framework
zeolites
oxides
iron
esr
mesoporous molecular sieves
h-femcm-41
butylation of phenol
solid acid catalyst
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Trivalent-iron-substituted mesoporous molecular sieve catalysts (FeMCM-41) were synthesized hydrothermally and characterized systematically by various analytical and spectroscopic techniques. Temperature-programmed desorption studies of ammonia of the protonated catalyst (H-FeMCM-41) indicate a broad distribution of the acid sites. Vapour-phase alkylation of phenol with t-butyl alcohol (2-methyl-2-propanol) was carried out over this solid acid catalyst and p-t-butyl phenol was obtained as the major product with high selectivity.
